| Overview                = The '''Archangels''' are (in [[Christianity]]'s hierarchy of [[Angels (Monotheism)|Angels]]), a choir of the [[Third Sphere]], along with the [[Archai]] ([[Principalities]]) and [[Angels (Third Sphere)|Angels]] (which name has become the common term for the entire kind).{{r|Marvel Zombies: The Book of Angels, Demons & Various Monstrosities #1|; [[Angels (Monotheism)|Angels]]' entry}}

Many [[Seraphim (Angels) (Earth-616)|Seraphim]] appear to be Archangels, which suggest it is more a title than a rank.{{r|Marvel Zombies: The Book of Angels, Demons & Various Monstrosities #1|; [[Angels (Monotheism)|Angels]]' entry}}

Choirs' leaders appear to be also sometimes Archangels:
* [[Zadkiel (Earth-616)|Zadkiel]] himself was the chief of the [[Order of Dominions (Earth-616)|Order of Dominions]],{{r|Ghost Rider Vol 6 21}} yet was also an Archangel.{{r|Ghost Rider Vol 6 33}}
* [[Haniel (Earth-616)|Haniel]], the disputed Archangel, was prince of the [[Choir of Virtues (Earth-616)|Choir of Virtues]].{{r|Gambit Vol 2 2}}{{r|Marvel Zombies: The Book of Angels, Demons & Various Monstrosities #1|; [[Angels (Monotheism)|Angels]]' entry}}

| HistoryText             = 
===Early years===
[[Olivier (Earth-616)|Olivier]] was the prince of the Archangels.{{r|Punisher Vol 4 #1}}

===War in Heaven===
During the [[War in Heaven]], Olivier sided with [[Lucifer (Earth-616)|Lucifer]] in his rebellion.{{r|Punisher Vol 4 #1}}

[[Zadkiel (Earth-616)|Zadkiel]], chief of the [[Order of Dominions (Earth-616)|Order of Dominions]],{{r|Ghost Rider Vol 6 21}} followed by at least some [[Malakim (Earth-616)|Malakim]],{{r|Ghost Rider Vol 6 17}} and leading the [[Black Host (Earth-616)|Black Host]]{{r|Fear Itself: Fellowship of Fear #1|; [[Heaven's on Fire]]'s entry}} allied with his friend Lucifer, who he ultimately betrayed to God.{{r|Ghost Rider Vol 6 18}}

| Notes                   = To ally with [[Johnathon Blaze (Earth-616)|Ghost Rider]], [[Malachi (Angel) (Earth-616)|Malachi]] told him he was part of a minor movement within the Angels, who rejected the violence of the Archangels.{{r|Ghost Rider Vol 5 2}} Though Ruth's violence was demonstrated, it is unknown if violence is a constant among Archangels (and if such a movement truly exist).
